text: we have some breaking news for unit
concerns the attack on a migrant center
just outside the Libyan capital Tripoli
we understand the UN has now raised the
death toll in this airstrike 253 they
say that includes six children and at
least 138 injures let's just show you
these pictures from yesterday look at
the scene there an absolute picture of
devastation and what we are hearing is
that bodies are at the moment still
being recovered from this rubble a
report from the UN says the center was
struck by two air strikes there are also
these really disturbing reports that
following the first impact guards
actually shot at the migrants and the
refugees who were trying to flee the
area we have that just coming to us in
the past few minutes or so on the
Reuters news agency now most of the dead
are believed to be sub-saharan Africans
they were attempting to reach Europe
from Libya and it's a confused picture
in terms of who may have been
responsible the Libyan government has
blamed this airstrike by forces loyal to
a warlord general Khalifa Haftar
but general Huff does forces accused the
government side of shelling the center
so it is still unclear exactly who is
responsible but to put this all into
perspective for you there are thousands
of migrants who are being held in
government-run detention centers in
Libya 60 detention centers just around
Tripoli alone so these detention centers
are in this conflict zone and the UN
said yesterday that they believe that
this attack could amount to a war crime
and now this breaking news that the
death toll has actually gone up to 53
six children as well a hundred and
thirty people injured and this news that
perhaps our guards shot at migrants and
refugees trying to flee so that is our
breaking news and we will be looking
into this and bringing you more
throughout the day
